verses.text: Likewise , ye wives , \add be\add* in subjection to your own husbands ; that , if any obey not the word , they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives ;
While they behold your chaste conversation \add coupled\add* with fear.
Whose adorning let it not be that outward \add adorning\add* of plaiting the hair , and of wearing of gold , or of putting on of apparel ;
But \add let it be\add* the hidden man of the heart , in that which is not corruptible , \add even the ornament\add* of a meek and quiet spirit , which is in the sight of God of great price.
For after this manner in the old time the holy women also , who trusted in God , adorned themselves , being in subjection unto their own husbands :
Even as Sara obeyed Abraham , calling him lord : whose daughters ye are , as long as ye do well , and are not afraid with any amazement.

Likewise , ye husbands , dwell with \add them\add* according to knowledge , giving honour unto the wife , as unto the weaker vessel , and as being heirs together of the grace of life ; that your prayers be not hindered.
Finally , \add be ye\add* all of one mind , having compassion one of another , love as brethren , \add be\add* pitiful , \add be\add* courteous :
Not rendering evil for evil , or railing for railing : but contrariwise blessing ; knowing that ye are thereunto called , that ye should inherit a blessing.
For he that will love life , and see good days , let him refrain his tongue from evil , and his lips that they speak no guile :
Let him eschew evil , and do good ; let him seek peace , and ensue it.
For the eyes of the Lord \add are\add* over the righteous , and his ears \add are open\add* unto their prayers : but the face of the Lord \add is\add* against them that do evil. \p
And who \add is\add* he that will harm you , if ye be followers of that which is good ?
But and if ye suffer for righteousness’ sake , happy \add are ye\add*: and be not afraid of their terror , neither be troubled ;
But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts : and \add be\add* ready always to \add give\add* an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear :
Having a good conscience ; that , whereas they speak evil of you , as of evildoers , they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.
For \add it is\add* better , if the will of God be so , that ye suffer for well doing , than for evil doing.
For Christ also hath once suffered for sins , the just for the unjust , that he might bring us to God , being put to death in the flesh , but quickened by the Spirit :
By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison ;
Which sometime were disobedient , when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah , while the ark was a preparing , wherein few , that is , eight souls were saved by water.

The like figure whereunto \add even\add* baptism doth also now save us ( not the putting away of the filth of the flesh , but the answer of a good conscience toward God ,) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ :
Who is gone into heaven , and is on the right hand of God ; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.
